str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.
A lie, falsehood, untruth; false religion. From pseudomai; a falsehood.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Near, nearby, a neighbor. Neuter of a derivative of pelas; close by; as noun, a neighbor, i.e. Fellow.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A bodily organ, limb, member. Of uncertain affinity; a limb or part of the body.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
